bestBHT.bht: Eager to satisfy his curiosity about Jesus, Zacchaeus sought him out, desiring to know what kind of person he was. However, his determination to see Jesus was thwarted by the crowd due to his small stature. Although his motives may have been unclear, God can use even our natural inclinations to lead us towards salvation and imprint truth on our hearts. Jesus, humbly mingling with the crowd, made it challenging for Zacchaeus to easily identify him.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: person. Curiosity then was his only motive, though his
determination not to be baulked was overruled for more than he
Albert Barnes: He had that curiosity which is natural to people to see one of whom they have heard much.
God makes use of every principle - of curiosity, or sympathy, or affection, or hope, or fear - to lead people in the way of salvation, and to impress truth on the minds of sinners.
Jesus mingled with the multitude, not seeking distinctions of that sort, and perhaps, 'in appearance,' not distinguished from thousands that followed him.
Marvin Vincent: He sought [εζητει]. Imperfect. He was busy seeking as Jesus passed.
Who he was. Lit., is. No to see what kind of a person, but which one of the crowd he was.
Philip Schaff: His curiosity alone is mentioned here; but some better motive, however ill-defined to himself, undoubtedly influenced him.
Could not for the crowd. He had tried, but failed because of the crowd, his stature making it necessary to get very near in order to see.
Archibald T. Robertson: He sought (εζητε). Imperfect active... He wanted to see which one of the crowd was Jesus.
Stature (τη ηλικια). No doubt of that meaning here and possibly so in Luke 2:52.
John Gill: having heard much of him, he was very desirous of indulging his curiosity with a sight of him
his desire to see Jesus was not of the same kind with the kings and prophets

the reason why Zacchaeus could not see him for the crowd, was not because Christ was little of stature, and was hid among them, but because Zacchaeus was little of stature, and could not see over their heads

bhtAttempts.bht: With curiosity as his motive, Zacchaeus sought out Jesus, eagerly wanting to see what kind of person he was. However, his determination was hindered by the crowd because of his small stature. Zacchaeus had heard much about Jesus and desired to indulge his curiosity by catching a glimpse of him. Despite his likely ill-defined motives, God can use even our natural inclinations, such as curiosity, to lead us to salvation and impress truth upon our hearts. Jesus, who did not seek distinctions, blended in with the multitude, making it difficult for Zacchaeus to easily spot him.

Eager to satisfy his curiosity about Jesus, Zacchaeus sought him out, desiring to know what kind of person he was. However, his determination to see Jesus was thwarted by the crowd due to his small stature. Although his motives may have been unclear, God can use even our natural inclinations to lead us towards salvation and imprint truth on our hearts. Jesus, humbly mingling with the crowd, made it challenging for Zacchaeus to easily identify him.

Driven by curiosity, Zacchaeus actively sought Jesus, wanting to see for himself what kind of person he was. Hindered by the crowd due to his short stature, Zacchaeus found difficulty in catching a glimpse of Jesus. While his motives may have been unclear, God can utilize even our natural inclinations, like curiosity, to guide us towards salvation and impart truth in our lives. Jesus, without seeking distinctions, blended in with the multitude, making it challenging for Zacchaeus to easily locate him.

Driven by curiosity, Zacchaeus sought to see Jesus, eager to know more about the person he had heard so much about. However, his efforts were hindered by the crowd, his small stature preventing him from easily spotting Jesus. Although his motives may have been unclear, God can use our natural inclinations, such as curiosity, to draw us closer to salvation and impress truth upon our hearts. Jesus, without seeking special attention, blended in with the crowd, making it difficult for Zacchaeus to find him.

Motivated by curiosity, Zacchaeus actively sought Jesus, eagerly desiring to see what kind of person he was. However, his determination was challenged by the crowd due to his small stature. Though his exact motives may have been unclear, God can utilize even our natural inclinations, such as curiosity, to lead us towards salvation and impress truth on our hearts. Jesus, not seeking any special attention, blended in with the multitude, making it difficult for Zacchaeus to easily locate him.
